DOCNAME: CASE OF MEZOTUR-TISZAZUGI VIZGAZDALKODASI TARSULAT v. HUNGARY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1 (length of proceedings);Partly inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a water management association founded under LAW no . DATE on ORG , with its seat in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the Szolnok ORG to issue an order for payment against a limited liability company . On DATE the respondent objected to the order and brought a counter - claim against the applicant . The proceedings continued as civil litigation .
CARDINAL . ORG held hearings on DATE , DATE and DATE . In the meantime , on DATE ORG imposed a fine on the applicant ’s legal representative for having failed to submit some requested documents .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appointed an expert architect . The expert submitted his opinion on DATE . The parties submitted their observations on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . At the hearing of DATE , the applicant ’s legal representative failed to appear . The court imposed a fine on him and invited him to make a statement in writing . He submitted his statement on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG held hearings on DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court heard the parties’ representatives , the expert and some witnesses .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s action and partly accepted the respondent ’s counter - claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE Regional Court dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . It filed a petition for review .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the petition for review .
